page.title: 02THE RIVER CLEDDAU
page.content: The River Cleddau opens out into Milford Haven just downstream from this block.It is tidal at this point.There is also a creek known as Cosheston Pill that branches off the River and leads to the village of Cosheston. At low tide,most ofthe creek is just an expanse of mud.Part of the creek provides mooring for yachts and small boats and there are also Navy floating targets and a target ship that are towed out to sea for Navy and R.A.F practice firing. There are Naval jetties on both sides of the River (at Burton and near Pembroke Ferry). The water and mud is home for many birds and heron, cormorants, shelduck as well as herring gulls, blackbacked and blackheaded gulls are very common. River trips are popular with tourists.
